title: PreciousMetapsICT
author: PreciousMetapsICT
content: Earlier this year, I made a WTB post looking for a low serial number Satori. I respect Satoris for being one of the original mainstream small funded btc collectibles, but always wanted one that stood apart and was unique.  While bitflyers are very unique and limited Satoris, the few I have seen have serial numbers in the 21k range. During my WTB, I received zero offers or pictures of a low serial Satori. So, my simple question is: What is the lowest serial Satori you've seen?  I have seen the Satori pic of serial 000001. I believe it was from their website or from google. What I am wondering is one you have actually laid eyes on or from a private pic.  I will not be of much help, as I think the lowest I've seen is not very low at all... maybe 15k. Not low enough that I considered it anything special. Bonus points if you have a picture or own it. Thanks!!PM-ICT

comments.author: Spokanistan51
comments.body: I have one with a serial in the 5xxx thousand and something. Low serials are rare.

comments.author: PreciousMetapsICT
comments.body: Quote from: Spokanistan51 on November 11, 2022, 03:40:19 AMI have one with a serial in the 5xxx thousand and something. Low serials are rare.Wow!! Searching through worthpoint I haven't seen any lower than 12k.  Nice Collectible!!

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: lowest one I have seen.its actually on ebay for sale now.https://www.ebay.com/itm/115586323809?

comments.author: PreciousMetapsICT
comments.body: On a side note - if anyone has a non cracked satori tube - I'm interested. My original tube is cracked and it drives me crazy.

comments.author: Spokanistan51
comments.body: Here is the 5### serial that was listed on Ebay a short while back. It looks listed again for 3x. Very rare for sure to see four digit serials. I wonder if these were purchased out of the vending machines as singles vs. the rolls in Japan? Most were likely tossed, hence how difficult it is to find a four digit.https://www.ebay.com/itm/285043661281?hash=item425ded19e1:g:QhAAAOSwC79jd~D2&amdata=enc%3AAQAHAAAAoMGtESBLg5StjB0CQcNEABggHIvFDAUcyTan8yslXuS6IYXR1FhDAcBwLgvDWmkTef8zkErpW1hxujI2Ihz%2BSyZl7APo53TK2U0LQzBnU45UCn7VnemmdQzMhDRiJ0XkfSQI0K%2BijODbX%2FIBBcd0auFZhclHT3M2v6uzt1OSg77GBQl7tDSN8oMeMapVm8Jnogxdzoh46H%2FJLaBcBsnyU9A%3D%7Ctkp%3ABk9SR6KygMqRYQ

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Quote from: Spokanistan51 on November 18, 2022, 09:28:15 PMHere is the 5### serial that was listed on Ebay a short while back. It looks listed again for 3x. Very rare for sure to see four digit serials. I wonder if these were purchased out of the vending machines as singles vs. the rolls in Japan? Most were likely tossed, hence how difficult it is to find a four digit.https://www.ebay.com/itm/285043661281Some of the only 4-digit chips I have seen were the ones that came with the "What is Satori Coin" promo packs.Was a plastic page cover filled with 4 sheet of paper in 7 languages describing what is Satori.Came with 2 chips tucked in the back top.These are in the 7000 range... I have also seen some in the 9000 range... so lends me to believe there were quite a few of these made? but who knows, maybe was just random??

comments.author: Spokanistan51
comments.body: Great info, thank you for sharing! I have also seen some in the 9000 range... so lends me to believe there were quite a few of these made? but who knows, maybe was just random??

comments.author: Spokanistan51
comments.body: 5329, anyone else have a low serial? Interesting this is one serial away from the one listed on Ebay, which I have never owned nor know the seller.

comments.author: PreciousMetapsICT
comments.body: Quote from: Spokanistan51 on November 28, 2022, 05:35:57 PM5329, anyone else have a low serial? Interesting this is one serial away from the one listed on Ebay, which I have never owned nor know the seller.seller replied to me that $2500 was his bottom dollar and maybe he will just have to list it in Japan as the Japanese people care about collectibles like this, much more than Americans. Also that people listing rolls of 25 don't even have numbers below 17,000, and that serials 50,000 to 80,000 were seized by the government and 10,000 were peeled.I kindly replied with a picture of my roll of sub 15k satoris and haven't heard back. for what its worth

Interesting this is one serial away from the one listed on Ebay, which I have never owned nor know the seller.https://i.imgur.com/R1FPN3i.jpgseller replied to me that $2500 was his bottom dollar and maybe he will just have to list it in Japan as the Japanese people care about collectibles like this, much more than Americans. Also that people listing rolls of 25 don't even have numbers below 17,000, and that serials 50,000 to 80,000 were seized by the government and 10,000 were peeled.I kindly replied with a picture of my roll of sub 15k satoris and haven't heard back. for what its worthDo you have a reference for this?To our knowledge, the serials only went up to 50500.
